comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Albert Herter (1871-1950) was an artist, and father of Christian Hurter, governor on Massachusetts and US Secretary of State (in the 1950s): en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Herter

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of Feb 21, 1914 reports on a pageant at the Hotel Astor in which Albert Herter played the role of Emperor Justinian (not a viking!!). query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D03E0DF163AE633A... I suspect that several other pictures in this batch (tagged with "venetian pageant") are of the same event.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Thank you to all for research into this interesting event! We will add more details when we update the descriptive information. (And will certainly identify Mr. Herter as the Emperor Justinian rather than a Viking!)
